Sentencas: Protonic ceramic electrolysis cells (PCECs) are an attractive green H-2 production technology, given their intermediate-temperature operating range and ability to produce dry H-2.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: However, PCECs will benefit from development of more efficient and durable triple conducting anodes where steam is split, H incorporated, and oxygen evolved.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: In this work, we evaluated the kinetics of the steam-splitting/H incorporation reaction on BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-delta (BPY) in comparison to the benchmark Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-delta (BCFZY) composition, replacing most of the transition metal elements (Co, Fe, Zr) with the lanthanide Pr.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: We prepared geometrically well-defined perovskite BPY and BCFZY thin films by pulsed laser deposition and performed simultaneous optical transmission relaxation and electrical conductivity relaxation measurements at 400-500 degrees C in 0.21 atm O-2 during switching of the steam partial pressure to isolate and compare their proton surface exchange coefficients (k).
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: The k values of BPY were comparable to those of BCFZY and more stable over time.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: According to angle-resolved XPS and STEM-EDS mapping of FIB cross-sections, the surface of BPY exhibited Ba enrichment, Pr deficiency, and Si contamination.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: In contrast, BCFZY exhibited Ba deficiency throughout, no obvious surface segregation, and less Si contamination.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: The Ba segregation on the BPY film appears to have promoted steam splitting/H incorporation kinetics even though the more basic surface reacted with the acidic environmental SiOxHy.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: Faster kinetics observed on stoichiometric BCFZY vs. Ba-deficient BCFZY confirmed the benefit of a high A-site Ba concentration.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)

Sentencas: This result contrasts with most work on perovskites applied in solid oxide electrolysis cell anodes, in which A-site segregation is considered deleterious for surface reaction kinetics.
Titulo: Proton surface exchange kinetics of perovskite triple conducting thin films for protonic ceramic electrolysis cells: BaPr0.9Y0.1O3-δ (BPY) vs. Ba1-xCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-δ (BCFZY)
